Text: Kicked off my morning at the Shepherd‚Äôs Breakfast in Las Vegas this morning. Thank you for having me @kelceywestmdiv -- looking forward to continuing to work together on voting rights, advancing equity, and ensuring every Nevadan is included in our recovery efforts. https://t.co/Ienb9iC2pA

.@GovSisolak is right. Raising kids isn't cheap.

Anti-choice extremists are already criminalizing reproductive care. Overturning #RoeVWade will only expand their control.

Water came up more than a few times during Saturday's town hall.

Las Vegas is growing & Lake Mead is shrinking. We can't wait for this to get even worse. That's why I fought for the #Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act to include funds for water recycling across the West.

I'm proud to have voted to pass the #Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act to deliver water solutions to combat this historic drought.

But we need to take action that will target the root of the issue too.

Climate change is here and Nevada is on the front lines. We must act now. https://t.co/4O0WqNC2Yf

I'm thrilled that we passed the COMPETES Act last week, but we need to get this over the finish line. 

Ending the disruptions in our supply chain and taking action to compete with China?  Everyone should agree on that.

Let's send it to @POTUS's desk ASAP.

From your apartment lease to a rideshare app‚Äôs terms ‚Äì forced arbitration clauses are everywhere, protecting people in power.

I voted to pass @RepCheri's legislation to #EndForcedArbitration so that survivors of sexual assault & harassment are not blocked from seeking justice.

On this National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day, we call out the inequities in our health care system and recommit ourselves to stand up for better access to testing, prevention, and treatment. Let's end the stigma and #StopHIVTogether.

Public lands belong to us all.

We shouldn't let oil companies get their hands on them when there's no chance of productivity. It's wrong, it‚Äôs reckless, and it's a waste of your taxpayer dollars. I've got a bill to stop it.

I want to get our economy back to the days when you never heard the words "supply chain" at the grocery store.

The answer is taking action to bolster manufacturing, create jobs, compete with China, and invest in innovation. That's the #AmericaCOMPETES Act.

The numbers speak for themselves.

With the passage of the #AmericanRescuePlan, we created a record-breaking 6.6 million jobs in @POTUS's first year. https://t.co/9E811SCruD

The urgency of this moment cannot be overstated. 

We must act now.
We must protect #Roe. (8/8)
When extremists insert themselves into this decision, they refuse to recognize women‚Äôs bodily autonomy and coerce them into having a future that they neither wanted, nor prepared for. (7/8)

It‚Äôs simple: I voted for #WHPA because politics doesn‚Äôt belong in the doctor‚Äôs office. The choice to become a mother is an extremely personal one, and one that should stay between a woman, her family, and her doctor. (6/8)

That's why on this 49 anniversary, I am calling on the U.S. Senate to send the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act to @POTUS's desk so that American women do not have to live in fear of a future without the right to choose. (5/8)

Nevada already has the voter-affirmed right to abortion care, but we cannot stop fighting until all women have access to that right, with no threat of being criminalized for making personal decisions about their health. (4/8)

2022 is on track to be an even worse threat to reproductive rights, as Republican lawmakers at all levels of government look to double down on their efforts to strike down the right to choose and take the fight to our nation‚Äôs highest court. (3/8)

Nevada has become a refuge for seekers of reproductive care who come from 19 states that enacted a total of 108 abortion restrictions in 2021‚Äîthe highest number since Roe v. Wade was affirmed by the U.S. Supreme Court nearly half a century ago. (2/8)

Today, on the heels of one of the most treacherous years for abortion rights in our country, we mark the 49th anniversary of #Roe v. Wade.

For decades, anti-choice politicians have been chipping away at reproductive care. Now, hard-liners are eagerly digging Roe‚Äôs grave. (1/8)
